R

react(IMove) - Method in class model.EliminationLevel
UserMoves and RearrangeMoves use up one move If the move is a valid UserMove, it also markes all tiles in that move
react(IMove) - Method in class model.Level
After every move, the board settles the tiles.
react(IMove) - Method in class model.PuzzleLevel
 
react(IMove) - Method in class model.ReleaseLevel
UserMoves and RearrangeMoves us up one moveRemaining, that is the only effect on the level
REARRANGE - Static variable in class model.Level
 
RearrangeBoardController - Class in controller
The controller attached to the "Rearrange" button in the LevelView Pressing the button will replace all non-six
RearrangeBoardController(Level, LevelView) - Constructor for class controller.RearrangeBoardController
Construct a new RearrangeBoardController for the given Level and its associated LevelView
RearrangeMove - Class in model
Rearrange moves clear all non-null, non-empty, non-six tiles on the board and replace them with new randomly generated tiles Sixes are never replaced because it can make Release levels unwinnable
RearrangeMove() - Constructor for class model.RearrangeMove
 
ReleaseLevel - Class in model
Release levels have a number of buckets.
ReleaseLevel(LevelState) - Constructor for class model.ReleaseLevel
Construct a new ReleaseLevel from the given state
ReleaseTopBarPanel - Class in view
Each Level type needs to display different information in the top bar Release levels need to show the moves left
ReleaseTopBarPanel(ReleaseLevel, LevelView, Application) - Constructor for class view.ReleaseTopBarPanel
Construct a new ReleaseTopBarPanel for the given ReleaseLevel, its view, and the top Level Application frame
ResetAchievementsController - Class in controller
 
ResetAchievementsController(Application) - Constructor for class controller.ResetAchievementsController
 
ResetProgressController - Class in controller
This controller resets all progress made so far.
ResetProgressController(ArrayList<Level>, PastLevelPanel, ArrayList<PastLevelButton>) - Constructor for class controller.ResetProgressController
Construct a new ResetProgressController
restart() - Method in class model.EliminationLevel
restart the level by setting score to 0, restore all used moves and specials
restart() - Method in class model.Level
Restarts the level.
restart() - Method in class model.LightningLevel
 
restart() - Method in class model.PuzzleLevel
 
restart() - Method in class model.ReleaseLevel
Restart the level
restart() - Method in class view.LevelView
Restart the level
RestartLevelController - Class in controller
This controller is bound to the "Restart" button in the LevelView When pressed, it restarts the level, and refreshes the gui.
RestartLevelController(Level, LevelView) - Constructor for class controller.RestartLevelController
Construct a new RestartLevelController for the given Level and its associated view
ReturnToMenuController - Class in controller
When activated, this controller returns the User to the main menu by changing the active panel in the application frame to a new menu
ReturnToMenuController(Application) - Constructor for class controller.ReturnToMenuController
Construct a new ReturnToMenuController for the given Application
run() - Method in class controller.EndLevelController
runs the Controller.
run() - Method in class controller.LightningCountdownController
Runs the controller decrements the time remaining by one, if that was the last second, stops the timer and ends the level
run() - Method in class model.LightningTimerTask
